intro: Krynitzkia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved krynitzkia, is a species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, linear leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical heads, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to red. Krynitzkia angustifolia is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
